ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed more insight into my own research project, both conceptually and in terms of research skills. I was able to hone my scientific communication skills both in presentation and written form. I also established meaningful connections with other faculty members to better elevate my own project, and learned how to become a more rigorous scientist.
Scientific writing, looking at big picture of your research project, planning experiments. Various lab skills that will depend on each person.
Learned so much about what goes on in the wet lab/what it takes to be a scientist! First wet lab research experience.

Taking research for credit this semester was very helpful for me because it facilitated me to further explore my research at the lab through a more academic lens, even formulating a final paper/thesis.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: It is great that students are able to do research for credit. This helped me make so much progress on my research project without needing to worry about taking another course just to reach the necessary Yale College credits for enrollment. 
Weaknesses: I ended up spending around 25-30 hours in lab every week...it would have been nice if there were an option for a 2-credit MCDB 474 course, or an option to petition for it to count as a 2-credit course. In fact, my PI thought that I was signed up for a 2 credit course based on how much time I was spending in lab. It would also be nice if there was a mini-symposium for MCDB 474 students to present their work and see what other students were doing with their semester.

-Course itself has very little structure which is a strength for most who just want to do research but may not be for everyone. 
-It is a great opportunity to get a credit for research you may already be doing anyways
It was so wonderful, because I had a kind/supportive PI who taught me a lot about her research and offered hands-on mentorship + I was able to shadow/help out the post-grad students.
The structure was very lenient but worked very well as long as the time commitment was fulfilled.
Good way to get credit for research.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! A great way to make decent progress on your research if your lab is unable to pay you, or you want to enroll in fewer classes to spend more time on research.
Yes, it is a great opportunity to get a credit for research you probably are doing anyways.
Yes!! Absolutely, if research is something they are interested in and/or thinking of getting into. This was a course I consistently looked forward to.
Yes. This is a great opportunity to earn credit for Yale and further explore topics you are interested in, especially if you were already working in a lab at Yale previously.
Yes! Great way to get credit for lab work.
